question.title: What is a collective foodborne outbreak?
question.description: A foodborne outbreak refers to a situation where a group of people become ill after consuming contaminated food or water.

option_a.title: A single case of food poisoning
option_a.description: A single instance of food poisoning that affects one person.

option_b.title: A cluster of cases with similar symptoms
option_b.description: A group of people who experience similar symptoms after eating the same food or drinking the same water.

option_c.title: A widespread epidemic of foodborne illness
option_c.description: A large-scale outbreak of foodborne illness that affects many people in a community or region.

option_d.title: A rare incident of food poisoning
option_d.description: An unusual and isolated case of food poisoning that does not follow a pattern or cluster.

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
